Articles.Content:
Things I'd like:

Clouds (which can be disabled for slow machines, and toggled in Map view)

Alarm Clock

Precise Node Editor (with the "o" hotkey to reopen collapsed nodes)

Hoses for Surface Refueling

Docking Camera (and mountable cameras for unmanned probes)

> 
> I doubt that it is life support, since HarvesteR already said more than once he was unwilling to put it on stock game.

Harv also stated on multiple occasions that other systems wouldn't be in the game, which are making an appearance in the next release(s), including procedural parts (fairings), science over time (the updated lab module), and a delta-v readout. I agree with you that life-support is unlikely, only because it would take a lot of work/balancing.

Other possibilities:

- Clouds (fingers crossed)

- Science over time space station modules, should be easy now that the science over time lab module is implemented

- Terrain scatter with collision boxes

- Command seats that can be manned in the VAB/SPH

- Proper parachutes

- Mapsat 

Any/all of these would be fine Felipe, thanks ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Full support for Brotoro's suggestions.

EDIT: also, CITIES! I think HarvesteR did some work "off-camera", and is planning to finish them at release date, and they were already walked through during QA. So now, it's just some texture tweaking and final testing..maybe?

> 
> Because if someone working on the game says its a long over due feature and all they give us are clouds it will make Squad look like a joke for a dev team, "Heres your long over due feature i've been working on some crappy unity engine clouds for you to look at for a few minutes every time you launch!"

Like a joke to who? You? Not me. Clouds are currently *not* featured in the game. So if Squad implements them then they *will* be featured in the game. And go figure clouds happen to be long overdue.

"Look at for a few minutes" ... Now c'mon, you gonna sit there and tell me you don't spend anytime in LKO? Or in planes?

But regardless all I'm saying is you need to redefine your view of what a "feature" is.
